summary: The Hudson's Bay Company (HBC) is a big Canadian business that started as a fur trading company in 1670. It became the largest and oldest company in Canada and now sells fashion and other items in stores across Canada and the U.S. Originally, HBC had a monopoly on trade in a large area called Rupert's Land. Over time, it changed into a department store business. The company has changed owners a few times and now owns brands like Saks Fifth Avenue. It's also buying the Neiman Marcus Group. HBC has a lot of stores and real estate.
title: Hudson's Bay Company
